Cansema Photos

WARNING – Graphic Images

Cansema Photos is a place for the reader to actually see the results of Cansema/Black Salve, that I have personally used to treat skin cancers/lesions over the past 8 years.
There will also be testimonials from friends that I have also introduced to Cansema/Black Salve and photos of their success as well.

Due to having a kidney transplant 4 years ago, I now take a regime of Anti-rejection Drugs that have a major side effect – Skin Cancers.
Having spent most of my life as a surfer/fisherman and have been subjected to many hours in the sun and been sunburnt many times.
The damage has already been done so to speak and the addition of the Anti-Rejection Drugs and the side effects from them only make the number of skin cancers I’m susceptible to so much worse.
I had undergone many sessions of surgery and Liquid Nitrogen for the removal of so many cancers that I’ve lost count, but I can tell you that most of the spots I’ve had removed, after being assured by the surgeon that they “Got it all” – I have always applied Cansema/Black Salve to the area worked on by the doctor/surgeon and have always had results from the backup application.
Cansema/Black Salve is now my number one treatment of choice before undergoing the knife, although nothing beats seeing a specialist regularly for a reliable checkup.
I’m lucky – I have a Skin Specialist who has a knowledge of Cansema/Black Salve and is happy to identify problems that I may have and supervise my treatment of them with Cansema/Black Salve.

There will also be testimonials from friends that I have also introduced to Cansema/Black Salve and photos of their success as well.

WARNING – Graphic Images – You Have Been Warned.

Set 1. Straubs.

Left Wrist.
        

Left Ear.
         

Left Thigh (Melanoma)
          

         

       

    
Bottom Lip. (In Progress)
             

Right Leg , Shin.
                

           

           

      

Set 2. Mrs Straubs. (Upper Back)
The horrible red marks are caused from an allergic reaction to the band-aids we used.
Mrs Straubs has spent many hours in the sun over her lifetime working in the bush on the family Cattle Station, wearing work shirts to within an inch of their life so that she ended getting sunburnt through her shirt while mustering from horseback.
            

            

        

Set 3. Sean.
                              
Sean is a 50 year old surfer and good friend who one night over dinner at a surf competition asked me how I was going with Skin Cancers due to the Anti-Rejection Drugs he knew that I had been taking since my kidney transplant.
I told Sean about Cansema/Black Salve and how I’d been using it for about two years, with multiple successes on every skin cancer/lesion I had treated.
Sean went out and tracked down his own supply and began treating anything that looked suspicious.
To date Sean has had success with every skin cancer/lesion he has treated.

Set 4. Trish.
           
Trish is a very good friend who was terrified of undergoing another round of surgery on her face to remove multiple skin cancers (Identified by her doctor).
This one being so close to her eye, she was worried abut having a large piece of her face/eyelid removed.
Trish took our offer to try Cansema/Black Salve before her appointment with the surgeons knife and this is what came out.
End story – no surgery and now another Cansema/Black Salve convert.

4 Responses to Cansema Photos

  1. Cheryl says:
    November 29, 2013 at 6:25 am

    Where can you buy this cream in Australia

    Reply
  2. Pat M says:
    June 6, 2014 at 12:36 am

    I have used Cansema/black salve on a variety spots and it has worked well. When I was younger, I have had freezing, acid, scraping/MOHs for a dime sized spots plus Efudex on my face. Cansema is a godsend especially for people who cannot afford surgery with a dermatolgist.

    Reply
  3. kt says:
    June 2, 2016 at 10:11 am

    I have ugly floating bone cartilage in the upper bridge of my nose.can black salve be injected into the bridge to dissolve the cartilage.note it was put there in a 2009 botched surgery and it is slowing floating and flaking off causing pain.

    Reply
    • Straubs says:
      June 2, 2016 at 11:37 am

      Hi KT,
      The main problem I see with injections, is finding a doctor that would consent to doing the procedure. Not to mention that Black Salve is in a granular form because of its herbal compounds.
      Black Salve does have penetrative properties and will assist in the removal of splinters, boils or foreign bodies in the skin.
      I honestly think your best option would be to see your doctor about reconstructive surgery on your nose.
      Black Salve is mainly used for Cancer removal.
      I’m not a medical specialist by no means KT and I don’t claim that Black Salve is a Cancer cure, but what I do know, from personal experience, is that I have used it hundreds of times, for over 10 years on BCC, SCC and one Melonoma.
      Each time with 100% success rate of removal.
      I hope I’ve given you some helpful advise, take your time and please consult your doctor about reconstructive surgery.
      Cheers,
      Tony

      Reply
